Comment: A true gentleman always accepts a gambit! Especially when it's offered by an amateur to a master.

A horrible move. The correct move is 3 N-KB3, preventing once and for all Q-R5ch.
White has no good moves. K-K2 offers possibilities of fleeing to the Q-side [K-Q3 and K-B3], but White wouldn't last long with that move either. His King would be at the mercy of Black's pieces.
Threatening a nasty discovered check. If White tries PxP Goetz will simply take the unprotected KR.
As good or bad as anything else.
If nothing else avails, Black can play PxR (Q) with an enormous material advantage.
Calling for a second chess set, as he wishes to borrow a Black Knight, and also calling, "Checkmate!" Well done, Mr. Goetz.
